climbs.name: The Lumberjack
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Andrea Tomaszewski, Jenn Starr, Karen Potts, Trever

content.description: This route is on or near Abbey Rock.  It in on the east end of the rock formation. It is an unusual climb as you need to climb up a tree for the start until you can flop out on the face and clip a bolt.  Climb up past a few bolts to a sizable black intrusion which you mantle on, and complete the climb.  Al Bartlett described this climb as " a serious waste of bolts. "....I think the climb is novel and challenging. It is close the the car too.
content.protection: bolts for the QDs. Maybe a cam or two for the anchor or something else.
content.location: Just east out of the parking area for Whispering Wall at Live Oak Area.

content.description: A great name and a good route - it climbs a coarse but fun hand crack. The descent (walk-off) is to the climber's left, zig-zagging down the slabby ramp that faces the road.
content.location: The climb is facing the parking lot.

content.description: Climb the chimney.  It turns into a gully; at the top of the gully climb a short face to the top.
content.location: This climb is on the northeast face of the rock, starting in a very obvious chimney to the left of a juniper tree.
